body:
This error shows up in installation of quite a few packages related to the GTK stuff.
glib, gdk-pixbuf, harfbuzz (and more ...) as discussed in #9879 #9769 #9885 #9771.

If i understand it correctly, the error originates from the fact that these packages automatically detect gtk-doc installations in the system which have python dependencies that aren't matched by the python provided by Spack.

```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux somehost 4.15.0-38-generic #41-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 10 10:59:38 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description: Linux Mint 19 Tara (=
Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS)
```
title: gtk-docs related "ImportError: no module named six/site" errors
